intro: Brassica pe-tsai var. dentata, commonly known as Chinese mustard or Shanghai cabbage, is a leafy green vegetable belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and broad, dark green leaves with a slightly bitter taste. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and is cultivated for its edible leaves and stems. It thrives in temperate climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. This variety is often used in Asian cuisines for its nutritional value and unique flavor profile.
